page.title: 02Healds Green
page.content:
The oldest building in Chadderton is in Healds Green,and it is now known as the Institute. It will be 200 years old in 1989. The Institute was built as a chapel for methodists and as a hall for everyone. The Institute is now a place where social functions are sometimes held. Most of Healds Green is green belt, there used to be a farm called Mount Pleasant, now we can only see the ruins. Healds Green is not very big,it only has 41 houses. At the bottom of the hill there are cottages, silk weavers lived and worked in them. There is only one road in Healds Green, it goes up the hill and on to Chadderton Heights.
